title: Mountain View College Academy
text:
Mountain View College Academy (or MVCA) is a <a href="private%20school">private</a> <a href="Adventism">Adventist</a> high school in <a href="Valencia%20City%2C%20Bukidnon">Valencia City</a>, <a href="Bukidnon">Bukidnon</a>, <a href="Philippines">Philippines</a>. It has an average student population of less than 200. It is located within the campus of <a href="Mountain%20View%20College%20%28Philippines%29">Mountain View College</a>. It also serves as the laboratory high school of the MVC School of Education. As of 2009, it has 14 teachers and 2 support staff. It is part of the <a href="Seventh-day%20Adventist%20Church">Seventh-day Adventist Church</a>'s worldwide <a href="Seventh-day%20Adventist%20education">educational system</a>.
Curriculum.
The schools curriculum consists primarily of the standard courses taught at <a href="college%20preparatory%20school">college preparatory school</a>s across the world. All students are required to take classes in the <a href="core%20curriculum">core</a> areas of English, Basic Sciences, Mathematics, a Foreign Language, and Social Sciences. 
Spiritual aspects.
All students take religion classes each year that they are enrolled. These classes cover topics in <a href="Bible">biblical</a> history and <a href="Christianity">Christian</a> and <a href="Religious%20denomination">denominational</a> doctrines. Instructors in other disciplines also begin each class period with prayer or a short devotional thought, many which encourage student input. Weekly, the entire student body gathers together for an hour-long chapel service.
Outside the classrooms there is year-round spiritually oriented programming that relies on student involvement.
